name: National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL). 2010. Tractor-propelled coal crusher;  Manufacture; For surface mine, at plant
description:
DESCRIPTION
Based on manufacturer specifications for a Gundlach Braker model 12048 (115,212 kg; 254,000 lb.), used in crushing coal, this unit process quantifies the amount of steel needed to produce the coal crusher.

CITATION AND ASSOCIATED DOCUMENTATION
This document should be cited as: 
National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL). 2010. NETL Life Cycle Inventory Data – Source: Tractor-propelled coal crusher;  Manufacture; At plant, Powder River Basin coal. U.S. Department of Energy, National Energy Technology Laboratory. Last Updated: Fabruary, 2010 (version 01). Retrieved on [DATE] from [URL for this dataset].

This dataset is part of the NETL Unit Process Library.  The Library offers additional information concerning this dataset in the form of a Detailed Spreadsheet  Documentation (DS) file and a Process Documentation File (DF).  The DS file  is an Excel file that contains all of the parameters, inputs, and outputs for a given system as well as background data, calculations and quality scores.  The DF file is a PDF document that contains major assumptions and data sources that are the basis for each unit process.  The NETL Unit Process Library is located on the NETL website (netl.doe.gov) under Research / Energy Analysis / Energy Trends and Issues / Life Cycle Analysis / Unit Process Library.

Full citations for the DS and DF are given below:

DS File
National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL). 2010. NETL Life Cycle Inventory Data – Unit Process: Tractor-propelled coal crusher;  Manufacture; At plant, Powder River Basin coal. U.S. Department of Energy, National Energy Technology Laboratory. Last Updated: Fabruary, 2010 (version 01). Retrieved on 6/30/2014 from: http://www.netl.doe.gov/File%20Library/Research/Energy%20Analysis/Life%20Cycle%20Analysis/UP_Library/DS_Stage1_C_Coal_Crusher_254000lb_2010-01.xls

DF File
